column4: I need a to ask a favor of everyone.. if you wouldn't mind helping me, here is my problem..
I have an evil mobo with an onboard i810 and I wish to use an ati radeon pci..
I've set the bios correctly and everything.
The problem is that ubuntu doesn't have an xorgconfig or similar only Xorg -configure..
This causes an error as it automagically generates an xorg.conf file that uses the i810 instead of the ati radeon.
I am familiar with xorg.conf but not enough to know what I need to change manually in order to correct this.
I have the ati card working fine with windows even after having to work aroung the same problem.
Any help would be greatly appreciated! ^_^
Install nvidia-glx and then type sudo nvidia-glx-config enable and restart the xserver.
if you know the name of your ati driver, you can type sudo dpkg-reconfigure -phigh xserver-xorg then swap the module name and remove the bus ID. i did it on a mate's pc
How do you remove the busID?
ati is a big mess in ubuntu IMHO ...
cant you put the intel module in blacklist?
hehe i decline all responsibility for consequences  ;)
dpkg-reconfigure doesnt ask you which driver you want?
